message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CC, cs.SE 

This paper discusses controlled natural languages (CNLs) and their use in knowledge representation and reasoning, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence (AI). Therefore, cs.CL and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the formalization of CNLs into logical reasoning systems, which falls under the category of computational logic (cs.LG, cs.CC). Finally, the paper proposes non-monotonic extensions of CNLs, which involves argumentation theory and reasoning about exceptions, which falls under the category of software engineering (cs.SE).
